snippet: At the White House, President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu came to little agreement on confronting Iran over its nuclear capabilities.
abstract: Pres Obama meets with Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu to discuss possible Israeli military strike on Iran's nuclear facilities; Obama maintains that European Union's impending oil sanctions and blacklisting of Iran's central bank could force Tehran to the bargaining table, not necessarily eliminating the nuclear threat but pushing back the timetable for the development of a weapon; Netanyahu argues that the West should not reopen talks with Iran until it agrees to a verifiable suspension of its uranium enrichment activities.
lead_paragraph: At the White House, President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu came to little agreement on confronting Iran over its nuclear capabilities.

headline.seo: Obama Urges Netanyahu to Use Diplomacy, Not Arms, to Check Iran
headline.main: Obama Presses Netanyahu to Resist Strikes on Iran
headline.print_headline: Obama Presses Israel to Resist Strikes on Iran
